required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Antecedent Picky Eating Behaviour in Young Children
clinical_study.official_title: Antecedents of Picky Eating Behaviour in Young Children

brief_summary.textblock: Picky eating behaviour in young children is a very common concern for parents. The aim of the study is to investigate factors during early life which are associated with a child becoming a picky eater.

detailed_description.textblock: Singleton children from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children will be studied prospectively (n=5758-6608). Parental-completion questionnaires will be used to define 'picky eating' status at age 3 years, and child and parental feeding behaviours and practices throughout the first 2 years of the child's life. Multinomial logistic regression models with 3 levels of picky eating status (not, somewhat and very picky) as the dependant variables will be used to test associations with antecedent variables, first assessing variables from pregnancy, and the first and second year of life, separately, then combining all significant variables in a final model.

primary_outcome.measure: Being a very picky eater or not at age 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Parent/caregiver answers 'yes, very' or 'no' to question on picky eating in questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Being a somewhat picky eater at age 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Parent/caregiver answers 'somewhat' to question on picky eating in questionnaire

clinical_study.condition: Feeding and Eating Disorders of Childhood

arm_group.description: Identified as a very picky eater from parental questionnaire
Identified as not a picky eater from parental questionnaire
Identified as a somewhat picky eater from parental questionnaire

study_pop.textblock: All pregnant women in the former Avon Health Authority with an expected delivery date between April 1991 and December 1992 were eligible for the study; 14,541 pregnant women were initially enrolled, resulting in a cohort of 14,062 live births with 13,988 alive at 1 year of age. Parents/caregivers were sent a questionnaire when the child was 3 years old that included a question on picky eating behaviour. Singleton children whose parents/caregivers answered this question were included in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Child enrolled in ALSPAC, singleton, parent answered question on picky eating behaviour in questionnaire
Exclusion Criteria:
- Child not enrolled in ALSPAC, multiple, parent did not answer question on picky eating behaviour in questionnaire

condition_browse.mesh_term: Feeding and Eating Disorders of Childhood

study_doc.doc_comment: ALSPAC data is available for use by researchers on application through the website
